edu.rit.image

Class ColorArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.ColorArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class ColorArray
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class ColorArray provides an array of colors. The color of each element can be specified as red-green-blue (RGB) components or as hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) components.

    Note: An instance of class ColorArray uses less storage than an array of instances of class Color.

      • ColorArray

        public ColorArray(int len)
        Construct a new color array of the given length. For each element, the red, green, and blue components are 0, yielding the color black.
        Parameters:

      • color

        public Color color(int i)
        Get the color of the given element of this color array.

        Note: The returned color object is a copy of the color array element. Changing the returned color object will not affect this color array.

        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        Returns:
        Color object.

      • rgb

        public int rgb(int i)
        Get the packed RGB representation of the given element of this color array. The packed RGB representation is an int with bits 31-24 unused, the red component in bits 23-16, the green component in bits 15-8, and the blue component in bits 7-0.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        Returns:
        Packed RGB representation.

      • rgb

        public ColorArray rgb(int i,
             int red,
             int green,
             int blue)
        Set the given element of this color array from the given integer red, green, and blue components. Each component is a value in the range 0 .. 255. (Only bits 7-0 are used.) A component value of 0 is fully dark; a component value of 255 is fully bright.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        red - Red component (0 .. 255).
        green - Green component (0 .. 255).
        blue - Blue component (0 .. 255).
        Returns:
        This color array.

      • rgb

        public ColorArray rgb(int i,
             float red,
             float green,
             float blue)
        Set the given element of this color array from the given floating point red, green, and blue components. Each component is a value in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.) A component value of 0.0f is fully dark; a component value of 1.0f is fully bright.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        red - Red component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        green - Green component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        blue - Blue component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color array.

      • hsb

        public ColorArray hsb(int i,
             float hue,
             float sat,
             float bri)
        Set the given element of this color array from the given floating point hue, saturation, and brightness components. Each component is a value in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.)

        The hue component gives the basic color. A hue of 0 = red; 1/6 = yellow; 2/6 = green; 3/6 = cyan; 4/6 = blue; 5/6 = magenta; 1 = red again. Intermediate hue values yield intermediate colors.

        The saturation component specifies how gray or colored the color is. A saturation of 0 yields fully gray; a saturation of 1 yields fully colored. Intermediate saturation values yield mixtures of gray and colored.

        The brightness component specifies how dark or light the color is. A brightness of 0 yields fully dark (black); a brightness of 1 yields fully light (somewhere between white and colored depending on the saturation). Intermediate brightness values yield somewhere between a gray shade and a darkened color (depending on the saturation).

        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        hue - Hue component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        sat - Saturation component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        bri - Brightness component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color array.

      • gray

        public ColorArray gray(int i,
              int gray)
        Set the given element of this color array to the given integer gray value. The gray value is in the range 0 .. 255. (Only bits 7-0 are used.) A value of 0 is black; a value of 255 is white.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        gray - Gray value (0 .. 255).
        Returns:
        This color array.

      • gray

        public ColorArray gray(int i,
              float gray)
        Set the given element of this color array to the given floating point gray value. The gray value is in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.) A value of 0.0f is black; a value of 1.0f is white.
        Parameters:
        i - Array index.
        gray - Gray value (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color array.

      • copy

        public void copy(ColorArray src,
        int srcoff,
        int dstoff,
        int len)
        Copy a portion of the given color array into this color array.
        Parameters:
        src - Source color array.
        srcoff - First index to read in source color array.
        dstoff - First index to write in this color array.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a nonexistent index in the source color array would be read or a nonexistent index in this color array would be written.
